errors.error_description: Installing pip dependencies before creating virtual environment and activating it
correction_candidates: Create a virtual environment first with `python -m venv venv`, activate it with `source venv/bin/activate`, then install dependencies with `pip install -r requirements.txt`
Use `virtualenv basxconnect_env` to create environment, then `basxconnect_env\Scripts\activate` on Windows, followed by `pip install -r requirements.txt`
Run `conda create -n basxconnect python=3.9` then `conda activate basxconnect` before installing requirements
Install dependencies globally with `sudo pip install -r requirements.txt` then create virtual environment afterwards
errors.golden_answer: Create a virtual environment first with `python -m venv venv`, activate it with `source venv/bin/activate`, then install dependencies with `pip install -r requirements.txt`

errors.error_description: References requirements.txt file that may not exist in the repository
correction_candidates: Install dependencies using `pip install django` and other required packages individually
Use `pip install -r pyproject.toml` instead of requirements.txt
Check if requirements.txt exists in the repository, or create it with `pip freeze > requirements.txt`
Install from setup.py using `pip install -e .` instead of requirements file
errors.golden_answer: Check if requirements.txt exists in the repository, or create it with `pip freeze > requirements.txt`
